doc.after: According to 2006 census data, 44.3 million people of the U.S. population were Hispanic or Hispanic American by origin;[51] 38.3 million people, 13 percent, of the population over five years old speak Spanish at home.[52] The Spanish language has a long history and presence in the United States due to historic Spanish and later, Mexican administration over territories now forming the southwestern states as well as Florida, which was Spanish territory until 1821.
